intro: Iris biggeri, commonly known as the Chinese iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking, violet-blue flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Iris biggeri is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
